[Thank you audiences for the wonderful feedback  !!
Can't wait for tonight !! ]
 
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED BUT NOT (ALAS) REQUIRED

If I'd known how brilliant this production would be, and how connected to what we are studying, I would have required you all to see it.

Loh Kok Man's direction of Kee Thuan Chye's script is a tour de force. The production employs all the techniques of Brecht in a South East Asian context. The play was originally written in English. It is performed in Chinese (with surtitles) in a Malay theatrical context. I had no trouble understanding it.

The staging is thrilling, The acting and movement are intensely physical -- and relate to Malay martial arts and dance -- as well as Indonesian Wayang, mask, and puppetry. Tuan Chye's script is full of reference to contemporary political issues and events in Singapore and Malaysia. Exactly what Brecht wanted to achieve in his writing.

Above all, the production is highly theatrical. It is long but holds the audience because of its inventiveness, energy, and verve. The stage is always alive and we are always engaged.
Only this weekend. Go see it.

【谢谢首场演出观众的观赏心得分享！！】

谢谢孙老师 Choonmee Soon 的介绍，昨晚的《剑鱼。妾》真的有让我惊艳！单是演员们丰富精湛的演出，就已经值回票价。原为《马来纪年》的寓言故事，透过剧场的创作被赋予了新的生命，经典文本融合当代思潮，激发出层层的思想浪花，一波一波。

剧场应该是让我迷恋都市的原因之一，这几年在十八丁做事的日子，总是喜欢在往返吉隆坡开会的之间，为自己安排支持艺术文化表演的行程。马来西亚的表演艺术发展，不缺很努力的演员及工作者，目前需要的是更多人愿意走入剧场，让我们的生活变得更有品质，特别是当经济越不好，紧绷的生活压力更需要找到宣泄的出口。

《剑鱼。妾》，那小男孩最后怎样了？那妾姬最后怎样了？接下来还有五场的演出，在吉隆坡一带的朋友可不要错过了，为这一群在艺术创作资源匮乏的环境中，仍然埋头努力的朋友们一些支持！

【谢谢首场演出观众的观赏心得分享！！】

刚结束长达3个小时的"剑鱼.妾"的精彩演出, 走出剧场外, 惊觉夜色早已被吉隆坡的霓虹灯点亮。

12月连续看了"马克白夫人"和今晚的"剑鱼.妾"的精彩演出, 心里感到非常的满足并充满激昂。

艺术的魅力唯有亲身体验, 才知道为什么会让人爱的无法自拔, 尤其是有着严谨制作的作品,是值得一而再三的欣赏和推荐。

"剑鱼.妾"改编自马来纪年里的故事, 导演结合了京剧的功架, 皮影戏,传统的说唱形式,把整个故事情节精心的铺排, 让张力凸显, 一切都是如此的恰到好处。我真的要赞赏罗国文Kok Man 导演的导戏功力, 让观众在3个小时内,有那么多惊喜。当然,演员的精湛演出,一人精准的分饰多个角色, 是整部戏的一个亮点。

夜色早已低垂, 我载着满足喜悦的脚步 - 回家。
不要错过接下来3天5场"剑鱼.妾"的演出, 好戏一定要共赏。

導演＋燈光設計＋空間設計／羅國文
Director + Lighting + Space Design／ Loh Kok Man

劇場導演、演員、燈光設計師、舞台設計師、戲劇導師以及【平台計劃】藝術總監。1993年畢業於馬來西亞藝術學院戲劇系，並於2005年創辦了“【平台計劃】，一直致力於搭建橋梁以多元藝術交流為本的團隊。曾獲馬來西亞金馬侖藝術大獎的“最佳導演”、“最佳燈光設計”、“最佳舞台設計”獎的羅國文，創作向來善於綜合多種劇場的元素，尤其是影像、燈光、聲響、演員肢體和劇場的戲劇架構間交錯互動所呈現的效果，豐富了對劇場視覺空間及時間的探索。導演的作品包括了《aku》、《城失空想》、《動物農莊》、《一個名叫紅豆妹的摩登師奶》、《雙重刺點》及《赤鬼》等。2005年他獲得美國“亞洲文化協會”獎學金遠赴美國游學半年，2013年獲得歌德學院獎金前往柏林一個月，也經常受邀參與國際合作交流計劃，曾赴日本、韓國、印度、德國、菲律賓、上海、泰國、新加坡、台灣及澳門等地參與演出和交流。

Loh Kok Man is Artistic Director of Pentas Project and an established theatre director, actor, lighting designer, theatre designer and theatre lecturer. He has won the BOH Cameronian Arts Awards for Best Director, for Best Set Design and for Best Lighting Design multiple times.

Loh founded Pentas Project Theatre Production in 2005 to produce critical and collaborative contemporary theatre. He is known for his unique way of integrating theatrical elements such as visual imagery, lighting, sound, physical movement and dramatic structures while exploring the concept of space and time.

His directorial credits include aku, The Lost and The Ecliptic, A Modern Woman Called Ang Tau Mui, Animal Farm, Double Punctum, Uda dan Dara and Red Demon. 

In 2005, Kok Man was invited to New York under a fellowship awarded by the Asian Cultural Council. He has since been invited to participate in numerous international theatre collaboration projects, allowing him to work in Japan, Korea, India, Thailand, Shanghai, Macau, Germany, Taiwan and Singapore.

Playwright ／Kee Thuan Chye

As a playwright, Kee Thuan Chye is best known for 1984 Here and Now and We Could **** You, Mr Birch. Both premiered on stage to full houses.

1984 Here and Now is included in the international anthology Postcolonial Plays, edited by Helen Gilbert and published by Routledge UK. We Could **** You, Mr Birch has been a text studied in Malaysian colleges and universities since the mid-1990s.

Another play, The Big Purge, was featured in ‘Typhoon 4’, a playreading festival in London held in May 2005.

Kee has also written numerous radio plays many of which were broadcast on RTM in the 1970s.

He has directed about a dozen plays for the theatre, including Shakespeare’s Macbeth and We Could **** You, Mr Birch, which was invited to the Festival of Asian Performing Arts in Singapore in 1995.

As an actor, he made his professional TV debut in a guest role in Bailey’s Bird, an Australian TV series, in 1977.

He has since appeared in the Hollywood films Entrapment and Anna and the King, and other international productions like the Hallmark TV-movie Marco Polo and Secrets of the Forbidden City for the BBC and the History Channel.

On Malaysian TV, he has appeared in City of the Rich, 10 (Sepuluh), Kopitiam, Each Other, Impian Ilyana, Realiti, Gol & Gincu II and Bilik No. 13.

On Singapore TV, he has guested in Phua Chu Kang, Code of Law, Singapore Shakes!, The Pupil and Mata Mata Season 2. He was in the main cast of the drama series Perceptions and the TV-movies Love Matters and The Circle House. 

In 2008, he played the lead role in the Mediacorp TV-movie Sense of Home: Kampung Kid, shot in Cambodia.

This year, he was in the main cast of the Mediacorp TV series Fine Tune.

On stage, he has acted in countless productions since 1977 but the one role he is proudest of is that of Willy Loman in Arthur Miller’s Death of a Salesman (1989).

In 1998, Kee was invited as a guest writer to the Melbourne Writers Festival, the Brisbane Writers Festival, and Spring Writing in Sydney. In 2001, he was invited to the inaugural Standard Chartered International Literary Festival in Hong Kong. In 2011, he was invited to the Writers Unlimited Tour held in Kuala Lumpur.

In 2008, he played the lead role in the Mediacorp TV-movie Sense of Home: Kampung Kid, shot in Cambodia.

This year, he was in the main cast of the Mediacorp TV series Fine Tune.

On stage, he has acted in countless productions since 1977 but the one role he is proudest of is that of Willy Loman in Arthur Miller’s Death of a Salesman (1989).

In 1998, Kee was invited as a guest writer to the Melbourne Writers Festival, the Brisbane Writers Festival, and Spring Writing in Sydney. In 2001, he was invited to the inaugural Standard Chartered International Literary Festival in Hong Kong. In 2011, he was invited to the Writers Unlimited Tour held in Kuala Lumpur.

馬來西亞演員、編劇、劇場導演、記者、作家、政治評論家……多重的身份讓他在四十年來於劇場、影視圈遊刃有餘。1981年在吉隆坡創立劇團“KAMI”。劇作《1984 Here and Now》和《We Could****You, Mr Birch》於當年首演時全場爆滿。《1984》後來被列入由英國勞特利奇出版的《後殖民戲劇國際文選》。《We Could***You, Mr Birch》自90年代中期在眾多本土大專院校被用作文本研究。另一部作品《The Swordfish, Then The Concubine》曾分別在2008年與2011年兩度搬演，也成為2006年英國WareHouse劇院舉辦的國際藝術節的五強作品之一。他演出過的好萊塢電影有《偷天陷阱》和《安娜與國王》，其他國際製作還包括Hallmark的《馬可波羅》和BCC歷史頻道的《紫禁城的秘密》。詩作《A Figure Forgotten In Hours Not-of-Need》也被採用為SPM水平的英語文學教材。其最新著作有《Unbelievebly Stupid!》和《Unbelievebly Stupid Too!》。

Run, run, Tun Dara, run.
They’re coming! … after me! 
Who? Who?

跑，跑，Tun Dara，跑。
他們來了！。。。他們來了。。。來捉我了。
誰？誰？

廖慧鳴 Leow Hui Min

表演者、鼓手、演員、舞者。藝術生涯由鼓手開始，漸漸轉向劇場藝術。參與演出類型包括鼓樂、舞蹈、戲劇。目前為馬來西亞“人人人鼓劇場”團員（2013年成立）。2013年畢業於法國波爾多三大，劇場表演藝術系。留學期間，深受意大利藝術家Claudia Castellucci 與法國舞蹈家Claude Magne的影響。2011年，與五個不同領域的法國及西班牙藝術家創立“Collectif In-Time”，同年創作作品“無編舞者的舞者”。此外也與法國藝術家Guillaume Prikhodko共同創作多個作品，包括戲劇、偶劇、舞蹈等。近年參與作品包括“人人人鼓劇場”制作《獨角戲》以及《眾鼓歌》、羅國文執導的《赤鬼》、楊偉漢執導的《玄奘西游》音樂劇、李人欣編舞的《B. E. D》等。

Leow Hui Min, a member of Orang Orang Drum Theatre, started his artistic journey from drumming, but he has acquired versatility as an actor and dancer as well after exposing himself to different types of dance training.
 
While studying for a degree in performing arts specialising in theatre at University Bordeaux 3 in France (Licence etudes théâtral), he formed a company called Collectif In-Time with five other dancers from France and Spain. Their first project, Danseurs sans choréographe, was presented at the University Dance Festival the same year.

In 2012, he attended University of IUAV in Venice under the ERASMUS programme. During his studies in Europe, he collaborated with French artist Guillaume Prikhodko on a few projects in theatre, puppetry and dance. 

In 2013, he graduated from University Bordeaux 3. His involvement in recent productions includes Hidup Ini Senget and LaguKu produced by Orang Orang Drum Theatre, B.E.D., Red Demon and Xuan Zang Journey to the West, a musical staged by Han Production.

周順興 Boyz Chew Soon Heng

人人人鼓劇場創辦人與藝術總監。以鼓手的身份開始他的藝術生涯，積極參與不同領域的表演藝術工作，其中包括舞踏、肢體劇場、戲劇等。目前為多所中小學的二十四節令鼓教練，同時也活躍於社區藝術活動。多次參與國際性的表演藝術節，曾到比利時、法國、台灣、澳洲、美國夏威夷等地演出。2013年4月，與廖世儀成立“人人人鼓劇場”，尋找探索自己的藝術理念——鼓劇場。曾创作的作品：《独角戏》、《众鼓歌》、《记一个时代》。2015年首次與平台計劃合作參與《赤鬼》的演出。

Boyz Chew Soon Heng is co-founder and artistic director of Orang Orang Drum Theatre. 

As a drummer, he has been experimenting with percussion for different types of performing arts, including Butoh dance and physical theatre. 

He actively promotes 24 Festive Drums through coaching and participating in various community art projects.

In the last 10 years, Boyz Chew has also participated in music festivals in Belgium, France, Taiwan, Australia, Hawaii, etc. In April 2014, he had founded Orang Orrang Drum Theatre with Zyee Leow Sze Yee, and continues to explore his artistic concept of drum theatre. Boyz’s recent works include Hidup Ini Senget, LaguKu, The Era and he had participated in Red Demon with Pentas Project in 2015.

廖世儀 Zyee Leow Sze Yee

“人人人鼓劇場”創辦人與助理藝術總監。有近19年的鼓手經驗，此外也嘗試了不同領域的表演藝術工作，包括音樂、舞蹈與戲劇。曾到荷蘭、比利時、法國、台灣、澳洲、美國夏威夷等地演出。除了在推廣二十四節令鼓教育上擁有豐富經驗之外，也積極籌辦藝術教育活動 ；2012年9月參與Kakiseni國際藝術交流計劃，與來自阿根廷、泰國、越南、英國、西班牙等藝術家交流。2013年與周順興成立人人人鼓劇場。2015年首次與平台計劃合作參與《赤鬼》的演出。

Zyee Leow Sze Yee is co-founder and assistant artistic director of Orang Orang Drum Theatre. 

She has been playing Chinese drum for nearly 19 years, and experimenting with different types of performing arts including dance and acting. She has participated in music festivals in the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Taiwan, Hawaii, etc.

Zyee also has a lot of experience coaching 24 Festive Drums and organizing educational programmes such as camps for coaches, drumming camps and community art projects. She had involved in Kakiseni Art Exchange Project 2012 to collaborate with artists from Argentina, Thailand, Vietnam, England and Spain. In 2013, She founded Orang Orang Drum Theatre with Boyz Chew Soon Heng and had worked with Pentas Project for Red Demon in 2015.
